intro: Thoa scandens, commonly known as the climbing thoa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial vine characterized by its twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
